  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Basic math skills (adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing whole numbers and fractions and converting fractions to decimals and vice versa)

  • None

We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours! The Opportunity Every creative person in the world experiences the Adobe brand every day. This is your opportunity to help define that brand. The Adobe Design Brand team is a small, focused group that creates all of Adobe’s product logos, defines the visual brand architecture, crafts illustrations used in-product, and executes every facet of the brand in UX. We work in pixels, but we also create environmental graphics, books, posters and swag items. We obsess on details and craft. We believe in the power of team critique and communicating our ideas more broadly. We work directly with marketing, executives, product managers, content strategists, and engineering teams. This is big, broad, challenging, and fun work that is highly visible. Our team operates within a larger experience design team, Adobe Design, that works on every Adobe product. There are many opportunities for collaborations of all kinds, including side projects, pro-bono work, and more. We want you to help us build the Adobe brand! You are a designer with a highly refined aesthetic. You love drilling down into the details and moving a finalized concept into production. You love participating in critiques of your own work and that of your collaborators. You can communicate about your design effectively in either a 2-minute elevator pitch or an hour-long concept review. You constantly spot bad typography in the world and wish you could fix it. You love corporate logos from the 60s. You know the best work comes out of constraints and love working in systems. What You'll Do Your responsibilities: Create beautiful logos for all of Adobe’s products. There are way more than you think and there are new ones all the time. Design the brand system: colors, rules, hierarchy, illustrative components, etc. Create production templates and workflows for producing assets for mobile, desktop, and any other place our brand surfaces across the customer experience. Collaborate with product designers and managers, brand strategists, engineers, and other business partners throughout the product cycle, balancing many projects simultaneously. Ensure that branding is implemented correctly inside of products, presentations, and other experiences. Craft communications including presentations, process documentation, articles, and more. Work on a variety of side projects including environmental graphics, conference graphics, posters, swag, and books. Help other designers within Adobe Design with brand-related work. What You Need To Succeed Minimum of 5 years of industry experience in graphic design, branding, or experience design Experience creating logos, icons, or other visual metaphors, and experience designing systems (brand systems, books, etc.) Experience presenting work to executive partners or clients Excellent written and oral communication skills Proficient with Adobe’s creative products (Ps, Ai, Id, Ae, etc.). Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

Every creative person in the world experiences the Adobe brand every day. This is your opportunity to help define that brand.

The Adobe Design Brand team is a small, focused group that creates all of Adobe’s product logos, defines the visual brand architecture, crafts illustrations used in-product, and executes every facet of the brand in UX. We work in pixels, but we also create environmental graphics, books, posters and swag items. We obsess on details and craft. We believe in the power of team critique and communicating our ideas more broadly. We work directly with marketing, executives, product managers, content strategists, and engineering teams. This is big, broad, challenging, and fun work that is highly visible.

Our team operates within a larger experience design team, Adobe Design, that works on every Adobe product. There are many opportunities for collaborations of all kinds, including side projects, pro-bono work, and more.

We want you to help us build the Adobe brand!

You are a designer with a highly refined aesthetic. You love drilling down into the details and moving a finalized concept into production. You love participating in critiques of your own work and that of your collaborators. You can communicate about your design effectively in either a 2-minute elevator pitch or an hour-long concept review. You constantly spot bad typography in the world and wish you could fix it. You love corporate logos from the 60s. You know the best work comes out of constraints and love working in systems.

What You'll Do

Your responsibilities:
  • Create beautiful logos for all of Adobe’s products. There are way more than you think and there are new ones all the time.
  • Design the brand system: colors, rules, hierarchy, illustrative components, etc.
  • Create production templates and workflows for producing assets for mobile, desktop, and any other place our brand surfaces across the customer experience.
  • Collaborate with product designers and managers, brand strategists, engineers, and other business partners throughout the product cycle, balancing many projects simultaneously.
  • Ensure that branding is implemented correctly inside of products, presentations, and other experiences.
  • Craft communications including presentations, process documentation, articles, and more.
  • Work on a variety of side projects including environmental graphics, conference graphics, posters, swag, and books.
  • Help other designers within Adobe Design with brand-related work.

What You Need To Succeed
  • Minimum of 5 years of industry experience in graphic design, branding, or experience design
  • Experience creating logos, icons, or other visual metaphors, and experience designing systems (brand systems, books, etc.)
  • Experience presenting work to executive partners or clients
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient with Adobe’s creative products (Ps, Ai, Id, Ae, etc.).
  • Experience doing production work, illustrations, motion graphics, or prototyping work.
  • An exceptional portfolio and resume.
  • A love of all things design

How To Apply

To be considered for this role you must submit a resume and portfolio.

About Adobe Design

Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud.

About Headway

Headway is building a new mental healthcare system, rewired for access and affordability.

We all know someone that has struggled with mental health - 1 in 4 people have a treatable mental health condition - but the overwhelming majority don’t get the care they need. The primary reason is cost - seventy percent of therapists don’t accept insurance, meaning paying for therapy is usually very, very expensive.

Headway is building the first national, virtual network of therapists who accept insurance, helping providers to expand their practices, and individuals to finally find a therapist they can afford. And we’re doing it all through software.

We launched in April of 2019 and are already powering thousands of therapy appointments every single day. To scale our mission, we’ve raised funding from the world’s preeminent VCs (backers of Facebook, LinkedIn, Slack, Uber, Oscar) as well as the nation’s most innovative healthcare entrepreneurs (founders of One Medical, Flatiron Health, and Clover Health).

We believe a team's strength is in its people. Headway is solving a national problem of affordability, and we know this cannot be achieved without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, and experience.

Join us, and make an impact.

The Role

Headway is looking for our first marketing hire to help us experiment our way into finding repeatable and scalable channels for generating a high volume of qualified therapist leads. From experimenting with Facebook ads to building growth product, you’ll work closely with Headway’s cofounder and Head of Growth to traverse multiple channels to help us find the 2-3 biggest, most efficient ones that can drive rapid growth and scale on the supply side of our marketplace. As our first growth marketing hire, you’ll define what exceptional looks like in this role and in the process pave the way for the marketing function at Headway.

You'll be a great fit if
    • You have 2-4 years of experience in growth marketing or growth product at a venture-backed startup, ideally a marketplace or SaaS business
    • You have a deep understanding of digital marketing channels and funnel optimization
    • You are deeply analytical: You can quickly size channels and opportunities, analyze results of an experiment to separate signal from noise and engage quantitatively to make recommendations about where we should invest or descope
    • You are off the charts scrappy: You love rolling up your sleeves and executing on experiments. Whether it’s writing copy for landing pages or talking to therapists to conduct user research, you’re as comfortable executing as you are strategizing.
    • You are creative and experimental: You’re an expert when it comes to rapid experimentation, capable of deploying small-scale experiments to help us validate strong beliefs and ensure we focus on the right channels
    • You are rigorous and detail oriented: You’re going to own experimentation end-to-end. You pay attention to the details to make sure things are set up the right way and our learnings are valid
    • You are energized by ambiguity: You are excited by the idea that the roadmap may change, because you will help build the roadmap.

Greater Chicago Area or Remote

Description
